      19             : namespace js {
      20             : 
      21             : // A call stack can be specified to the JS engine such that all JS entry/exits
      22             : // to functions push/pop an entry to/from the specified stack.
      23             : //
      24             : // For more detailed information, see vm/GeckoProfiler.h.
      25             : //
      26             : class ProfileEntry
      27             : {
      28             :     // All fields are marked volatile to prevent the compiler from re-ordering
      29             :     // instructions. Namely this sequence:
      30             :     //
      31             :     //    entry[size] = ...;
      32             :     //    size++;
      33             :     //
      34             :     // If the size modification were somehow reordered before the stores, then
      35             :     // if a sample were taken it would be examining bogus information.
      36             :     //
      37             :     // A ProfileEntry represents both a C++ profile entry and a JS one.
      38             : 
      39             :     // Descriptive string of this entry. Can be a static string or a dynamic
      40             :     // string. If it's a dynamic string (which will need to be copied during
      41             :     // sampling), then isCopyLabel() needs to return true.
      42             :     const char * volatile string;
      43             : 
      44             :     // An additional descriptive string of this entry. Can be null.
      45             :     const char * volatile dynamicString;
      46             : 
      47             :     // Stack pointer for non-JS entries, the script pointer otherwise.
      48             :     void * volatile spOrScript;
      49             : 
      50             :     // Line number for non-JS entries, the bytecode offset otherwise.
      51             :     int32_t volatile lineOrPcOffset;
      52             : 
      53             :     // General purpose storage describing this frame.
      54             :     uint32_t volatile flags_;
      55             : 
      56             :   public:
      57             :     // These traits are bit masks. Make sure they're powers of 2.
      58             :     enum Flags : uint32_t {
      59             :         // Indicate whether a profile entry represents a CPP frame. If not set,
      60             :         // a JS frame is assumed by default. You're not allowed to publicly
      61             :         // change the frame type. Instead, initialize the ProfileEntry as either
      62             :         // a JS or CPP frame with `initJsFrame` or `initCppFrame` respectively.
      63             :         IS_CPP_ENTRY = 0x01,
      64             : 
      65             :         // Indicates that the label string is not a static string and needs to
      66             :         // be copied during sampling.
      67             :         FRAME_LABEL_COPY = 0x02,
      68             : 
      69             :         // This ProfileEntry is a dummy entry indicating the start of a run
      70             :         // of JS pseudostack entries.
      71             :         BEGIN_PSEUDO_JS = 0x04,
      72             : 
      73             :         // This flag is used to indicate that an interpreter JS entry has OSR-ed
      74             :         // into baseline.
      75             :         OSR = 0x08,
      76             : 
      77             :         // Union of all flags.
      78             :         ALL = IS_CPP_ENTRY|FRAME_LABEL_COPY|BEGIN_PSEUDO_JS|OSR,
      79             : 
      80             :         // Mask for removing all flags except the category information.
      81             :         CATEGORY_MASK = ~ALL
      82             :     };
      83             : 
      84             :     // Keep these in sync with devtools/client/performance/modules/categories.js
      85             :     enum class Category : uint32_t {
      86             :         OTHER    = 0x10,
      87             :         CSS      = 0x20,
      88             :         JS       = 0x40,
      89             :         GC       = 0x80,
      90             :         CC       = 0x100,
      91             :         NETWORK  = 0x200,
      92             :         GRAPHICS = 0x400,
      93             :         STORAGE  = 0x800,
      94             :         EVENTS   = 0x1000,
      95             : 
      96             :         FIRST    = OTHER,
      97             :         LAST     = EVENTS
      98             :     };
      99             : 
     100             :     static_assert((static_cast<int>(Category::FIRST) & Flags::ALL) == 0,
     101             :                   "The category bitflags should not intersect with the other flags!");
     102             : 
     103             :     // All of these methods are marked with the 'volatile' keyword because the
     104             :     // Gecko Profiler's representation of the stack is stored such that all
     105             :     // ProfileEntry instances are volatile. These methods would not be
     106             :     // available unless they were marked as volatile as well.
     107             : 
     108             :     bool isCpp() const volatile { return hasFlag(IS_CPP_ENTRY); }
     109             :     bool isJs() const volatile { return !isCpp(); }
     110             : 
     111             :     bool isCopyLabel() const volatile { return hasFlag(FRAME_LABEL_COPY); }
     112             : 
     113       67663 :     void setLabel(const char* aString) volatile { string = aString; }
     114          20 :     const char* label() const volatile { return string; }
     115             : 
     116       33997 :     void setDynamicString(const char* aDynamicString) volatile { dynamicString = aDynamicString; }
     117           0 :     const char* getDynamicString() const volatile { return dynamicString; }
     118             : 
     119             :     void initJsFrame(JSScript* aScript, jsbytecode* aPc) volatile {
     120       29808 :         flags_ = 0;
     121       29808 :         spOrScript = aScript;
     122       29808 :         setPC(aPc);
     123             :     }
     124             :     void initCppFrame(void* aSp, uint32_t aLine) volatile {
     125       37855 :         flags_ = IS_CPP_ENTRY;
     126       37855 :         spOrScript = aSp;
     127       37855 :         lineOrPcOffset = static_cast<int32_t>(aLine);
     128             :     }
     129             : 
     130             :     void setFlag(uint32_t flag) volatile {
     131             :         MOZ_ASSERT(flag != IS_CPP_ENTRY);
     132       67668 :         flags_ |= flag;
     133             :     }
     134             :     void unsetFlag(uint32_t flag) volatile {
     135             :         MOZ_ASSERT(flag != IS_CPP_ENTRY);
     136       33992 :         flags_ &= ~flag;
     137             :     }
     138             :     bool hasFlag(uint32_t flag) const volatile {
     139         676 :         return bool(flags_ & flag);
     140             :     }
     141             : 
     142             :     uint32_t flags() const volatile {
     143             :         return flags_;
     144             :     }
     145             : 
     146             :     uint32_t category() const volatile {
     147           0 :         return flags_ & CATEGORY_MASK;
     148             :     }
     149         331 :     void setCategory(Category c) volatile {
     150             :         MOZ_ASSERT(c >= Category::FIRST);
     151             :         MOZ_ASSERT(c <= Category::LAST);
     152       33997 :         flags_ &= ~CATEGORY_MASK;
     153             :         setFlag(static_cast<uint32_t>(c));
     154         331 :     }
     155             : 
     156             :     void setOSR() volatile {
     157             :         MOZ_ASSERT(isJs());
     158             :         setFlag(OSR);
     159             :     }
     160             :     void unsetOSR() volatile {
     161             :         MOZ_ASSERT(isJs());
     162             :         unsetFlag(OSR);
     163             :     }
     164             :     bool isOSR() const volatile {
     165             :         return hasFlag(OSR);
     166             :     }
     167             :

     169             :         MOZ_ASSERT(!isJs());
     170           0 :         return spOrScript;

     172             :     JS_PUBLIC_API(JSScript*) script() const volatile;

     179             :     JSScript* rawScript() const volatile {

     181           0 :         return (JSScript*)spOrScript;
     182             :     }
     183             : 
     184             :     // We can't know the layout of JSScript, so look in vm/GeckoProfiler.cpp.
     185             :     JS_FRIEND_API(jsbytecode*) pc() const volatile;
     186             :     JS_FRIEND_API(void) setPC(jsbytecode* pc) volatile;
     187             : 
     188             :     void trace(JSTracer* trc);
     189             : 
     190             :     // The offset of a pc into a script's code can actually be 0, so to
     191             :     // signify a nullptr pc, use a -1 index. This is checked against in
     192             :     // pc() and setPC() to set/get the right pc.
     193             :     static const int32_t NullPCOffset = -1;
     194             : 
     195             :     static size_t offsetOfLabel() { return offsetof(ProfileEntry, string); }
     196             :     static size_t offsetOfSpOrScript() { return offsetof(ProfileEntry, spOrScript); }
     197             :     static size_t offsetOfLineOrPcOffset() { return offsetof(ProfileEntry, lineOrPcOffset); }
     198             :     static size_t offsetOfFlags() { return offsetof(ProfileEntry, flags_); }
